content.description:
A particular genetic disorder results from a single change in the amino acid sequence coded for in a gene. Parts of the sequence in normal and mutated genes are shown below.

Normal:
 <math alttext="T A C, C T C, G T G, G A C, T G A, G G T, C T C" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>TAC CTC GTG GAC TGA GGT CTC</mtext></mrow></math>

Mutated:
 <math alttext="T A C, C T C, G T G, G A C, T G A, G G T, C A C" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>TAC CTC GTG GAC TGA GGT CAC</mtext></mrow></math>
content.question: Based on the codon chart, which of the following amino acid changes is most likely found in the mutated protein?

skill.text: 6.E: Predict the causes or effects of a change in, or disruption to, one or more components in a biological system.
